channel.title: Need help
channel.description: I am using Lummyscapes base and I was wondering to create my server via Hamachi, I was wondering where the code is I have to change to my ip and the no-ip host. I can't find it in any of the coding of lummyscape. :/

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @ragingdragon4 ragingdragon4
item.description:
@ragingdragon4 wrote:

Josephx:

Simple fix change the Publer server string ip thing from 0.0.0.0 to your hamachi ip DONT change the dropbox cache link it pretty much gives you your interface for your server. Compile and your good to go.

I tried doing this and it said error connecting to server. I have no clue why it is doing this.

EDIT: Ended up finding this in the client.java

}

public void method50(boolean arg0) {
	if (arg0 != true)
		anInt3485 = 22;
	anInt3469++;
	Frame frame = new Frame("Jagex");
	frame.pack();
	frame.dispose();
	Class85.method812((byte) -116);
	Class131_Sub42.aClass88_4688 = new Class88(Class23_Sub4.aSignLink_3734);
	Class46.aClass179_640 = new Class179();
	if ((HashMap.anInt3138 ^ 0xffffffff) != -1)
		Class131_Sub41_Sub19.aByteArrayArray6412 = new byte[50][];
	Class108.method930(1, Class23_Sub4.aSignLink_3734); //1 was 2 before , now default hd
	if (Class1_Sub7.anInt3581 == 0) {
		Class131_Sub2_Sub7.aString5636 = [b]ClientSettings.ip;[/b]
		Class91.anInt1183 = [b]ClientSettings.port;[/b]
		Class131_Sub41_Sub20.anInt6436 = [b]ClientSettings.port;[/b]
	} else if (Class1_Sub7.anInt3581 == 1) {
		Class131_Sub2_Sub7.aString5636 = [b]ClientSettings.ip;[/b]
		Class131_Sub41_Sub20.anInt6436 = [b]ClientSettings.port[/b];// Class93.anInt1227 + 40000;
		Class91.anInt1183 = ClientSettings.port;// 50000 + Class93.anInt1227;
	} else if ((Class1_Sub7.anInt3581 ^ 0xffffffff) == -3) {
		Class91.anInt1183 = ClientSettings.port;// Class93.anInt1227 + 50000;
		Class131_Sub41_Sub20.anInt6436 = [b]ClientSettings.port;[/b]
		Class131_Sub2_Sub7.aString5636 = [b]ClientSettings.ip;[/b]

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @Josephx Josephx
item.description:
@Josephx wrote:

Simple fix change the Publer server string ip thing from 0.0.0.0 to your hamachi ip DONT change the dropbox cache link it pretty much gives you your interface for your server. Compile and your good to go.

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

[quote=“ragingdragon4, post:5, topic:453796”][quote author=pray4urlife link=topic=556638.msg4074436#msg4074436 date=1344657992]
Open your client folder search for gui.java once its open search 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0 and no-ip. if there’s no gui.java search for client.java search in there for the same if nothing then search in client.java for server = and server.equal.
[/quote]
There is not a gui.java, I found the client.java and I have searched through all files everywhere and I can’t find anywhere the client is connecting to a server at. I searched for: 127.0, 0.0, no, no-ip, server, server =, and server.equal. I have not found anything in there about it.

EDIT: I ended up searching for just “IP” and I found this:

}
public static final String cacheLink = “http://dl.dropbox.com/u/19514735/.rspsCache2.zip”; //make sure it zip
public static final int cacheRevision = 4; //change this if you edit cache

public static final String ip = "0.0.0.0";
  1. What does this cache have to do with anything do I have to download it?

I think this is the one I need

  1. I should change this to my no-ip.biz website ip correct?

EDIT 2: /*
* dont worry even trying hacking, this user is limited
*/
public static final String server_list_database = “. . . :3306/. . .”; //ip, database
public static final String server_list_user = ". . . "; //user
public static final String server_list_pass = “. . .”; //pass
}

( I deleted the items where “. . .” is for protection of the owner.) I am assuming this is another place I need to add my ip as well?

EDIT 3: Also Found this

    /**
     * @return
     */
    private static ListedServer[] loadServers() {
    	try {
        	ResultSet results = getResults("SELECT * FROM servers"); 
           	List<ListedServer> servers = new LinkedList<ListedServer>();
        	while(results.next()) {
        		servers.add(new ListedServer(results.getString("server_ip")
        				, results.getString("server_name")
        				, results.getString("discription")
        				, results.getInt("server_port")
        				, results.getInt("id")
        				,results.getString("status").equals("Online"))); //TODO 
        	}
        	return servers.toArray(new ListedServer[servers.size()]);
    	}catch (Exception e) {
    		e.printStackTrace();
    		return null;
    	}
    }
    
    private static class ListedServer {
    	
    	protected String ip, name, description;
    	protected int portId, id;
    	protected boolean online; 
    	
    	private ListedServer(String ip, String name, String description, int portId, int id, boolean online) {
    		this.ip = ip;
    		this.name = name;
    		this.description = description;
    		this.portId = portId;
    		this.id = id;
    		this.online = online;
    	}
    	
    }

}
[/quote]
Hmm… il try and fix it via teamviewer :L i had to go yesterday. and im back!

Read full topic

item.title: Need help
item.dc:creator: @ragingdragon4 ragingdragon4
item.description:
@ragingdragon4 wrote:

pray4urlife:

Open your client folder search for gui.java once its open search 127.0.0.1, 0.0.0.0 and no-ip. if there’s no gui.java search for client.java search in there for the same if nothing then search in client.java for server = and server.equal.

There is not a gui.java, I found the client.java and I have searched through all files everywhere and I can’t find anywhere the client is connecting to a server at. I searched for: 127.0, 0.0, no, no-ip, server, server =, and server.equal. I have not found anything in there about it.

EDIT: I ended up searching for just “IP” and I found this:

}
public static final String cacheLink = “http://dl.dropbox.com/u/19514735/.rspsCache2.zip”; //make sure it zip
public static final int cacheRevision = 4; //change this if you edit cache

public static final String ip = "0.0.0.0";
  1. What does this cache have to do with anything do I have to download it?

I think this is the one I need

  1. I should change this to my no-ip.biz website ip correct?

EDIT 2: /*
* dont worry even trying hacking, this user is limited
*/
public static final String server_list_database = “. . . :3306/. . .”; //ip, database
public static final String server_list_user = ". . . "; //user
public static final String server_list_pass = “. . .”; //pass
}

( I deleted the items where “. . .” is for protection of the owner.) I am assuming this is another place I need to add my ip as well?

EDIT 3: Also Found this

    /**
     * @return
     */
    private static ListedServer[] loadServers() {
    	try {
        	ResultSet results = getResults("SELECT * FROM servers"); 
           	List<ListedServer> servers = new LinkedList<ListedServer>();
        	while(results.next()) {
        		servers.add(new ListedServer(results.getString("server_ip")
        				, results.getString("server_name")
        				, results.getString("discription")
        				, results.getInt("server_port")
        				, results.getInt("id")
        				,results.getString("status").equals("Online"))); //TODO 
        	}
        	return servers.toArray(new ListedServer[servers.size()]);
    	}catch (Exception e) {
    		e.printStackTrace();
    		return null;
    	}
    }
    
    private static class ListedServer {
    	
    	protected String ip, name, description;
    	protected int portId, id;
    	protected boolean online; 
    	
    	private ListedServer(String ip, String name, String description, int portId, int id, boolean online) {
    		this.ip = ip;
    		this.name = name;
    		this.description = description;
    		this.portId = portId;
    		this.id = id;
    		this.online = online;
    	}
    	
    }

}
